name: zig-luajit
description: Run Lua code in Zig apps! A package providing Zig language bindings to LuaJIT.
readme:
# zig-luajit **Zig âš¡ language bindings for the [LuaJIT](https://luajit.org/) C API. Use `zig-luajit` to run [Lua scripts](https://www.lua.org/) within a Zig application.** ![Ubuntu Regression Tests Badge](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/sackosoft/zig-luajit/tests-ubuntu.yml?label=Tests%20Ubuntu) ![Windows Regression Tests Badge](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/sackosoft/zig-luajit/tests-windows.yml?label=Tests%20Windows)
## About The goal of the `zig-luajit` project is to provide the most idiomatic Zig language bindings for the LuaJIT C API and C API Auxilary Library. Additionally the `zig-luajit` project emphasizes safety by making liberal use of runtime safety checks in `Debug` and `ReleaseSafe` builds and provides full test coverage of the API. ## Zig Version The `main` branch targets the latest stable Zig version. Currently `0.15.1`. For other Zig versions look for branches with the named version. ## Installation & Usage It is recommended that you install `zig-luajit` using `zig fetch`. This will add a `luajit` dependency to your `build.zig.zon` file. ```bash zig fetch --save=luajit git+https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit ``` Next, in order for your code to import `zig-luajit`, you'll need to update your `build.zig` to do the following: 1. get a reference the `zig-luajit` dependency. 2. get a reference to the `luajit` module, which contains the core Zig language bindings for LuaJIT. 3. add the module as an import to your executable or library. ```zig // (1) Get a reference to the `zig fetch`'ed dependency const luajit_dep = b.dependency("luajit", .{ .target = target, .optimize = optimize, }); // (2) Get a reference to the language bindings module. const luajit = luajit_dep.module("luajit"); // Set up your library or executable const lib = // ... const exe = // ... // (3) Add the module as an import to your executable or library. my_exe.root_module.addImport("luajit", luajit); my_lib.root_module.addImport("luajit", luajit); ``` Now the code in your library or exectable can import and use the LuaJIT Zig API! ```zig const luajit = @import("luajit"); const Lua = luajit.Lua; var gpa = std.heap.GeneralPurposeAllocator(.{}){}; const lua = Lua.init(gpa.allocator()); defer lua.deinit(); lua.openBaseLib(); lua.doString( \\ print("Hello, world!") ); ``` ## Examples Some examples are provided in [examples/](./examples/) to aid users in learning to use `zig-luajit`. These small self-contained applications should always be working, please create an issue if they do not work for you. ```zig const std = @import("std"); const Lua = @import("luajit").Lua; pub fn main() !void { var gpa = std.heap.GeneralPurposeAllocator(.{}){}; defer _ = gpa.deinit(); const lua = try Lua.init(gpa.allocator()); defer lua.deinit(); lua.openBaseLib(); try lua.doString( \\ message = "Hello, world!" \\ print(message) ); } ``` ## Language Binding Coverage Progress | API | Support | |-----------------------------|---------------------------------------| | Lua C API (`lua_*`) | ðŸŽ‰ 100% coverageâ€  (92/92) | | Auxilary Library (`luaL_*`) | ðŸ¤© 100% coverage (48/48) | | Debug API (`lua_Debug`) | ðŸ¥³ 100% coverage (12/12) | | LuaJIT Extensions | *No plans to implement.* | *â€ : Coroutine yield/resume is not yet part of the public `zig-luajit` Zig API, see [#6][ISSUE-6].* ## Coverage and Compatibility This section describes the current status of Zig language bindings ("the Zig API"). * â˜‘ï¸ Fully Supported: Test coverage and runtime safety checks enabled in `Debug` or `ReleaseSafe` builds. * âž– Internal: Used internally and intentionally hidden from the Zig API. * ðŸ†– Superseded: Has no direct Zig equivalent, but the functionality is provided by a different part of the Zig API. * ðŸ“¢ Renamed: Renamed in a non-obvious way from the C API. Renaming is avoided but done in cases deemed required: 1. to conform to Zig idioms or patterns, such as the `init()` / `deinit()` pattern. 1. to avoid conflicts with Zig language keywords, such as the Zig `error` keyword. 1. to show that the Zig API has slightly different behavior than the C API, such as using `lua.setAllocator()` instead of `lua.setAllocF()`; since the Zig API uses `std.mem.Allocator` instead of allocation functions. 1. to improve the clarity, discoverability or consistency of the symbol in the overall API surface. ### Core C API Coverage (`lua_`) | C Type Definition | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------| | `lua_State` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua` | | `lua_Alloc` | âž– Hidden, please use `lua.setAllocator()` and `lua.getAllocator()` | | `lua_CFunction` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.CFunction` | | `lua_Integer` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua.Integer` | | `lua_Number` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua.Number` | | `lua_Reader` | â˜‘ï¸ [`std.io.AnyReader`][ZIG-DOC-ANYREADER] | | `lua_Writer` | â˜‘ï¸ [`std.io.AnyWriter`][ZIG-DOC-ANYWRITER] | [ZIG-DOC-ANYREADER]: https://ziglang.org/documentation/master/std/#std.io.AnyReader [ZIG-DOC-ANYWRITER]: https://ziglang.org/documentation/master/std/#std.io.AnyWriter | C API Symbols | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `lua_atpanic` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.atPanic()` | | `lua_call` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.call()` | | `lua_pcall` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.callProtected()` | | `lua_cpcall` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.callProtectedC()` | | `lua_checkstack` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkStack()` | | `lua_close` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.deinit()` | | `lua_concat` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.concat()` | | `lua_createtable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.createTable()` | | `lua_dump` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.dump()` | | `lua_equal` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.equal()` | | `lua_error` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.raiseError()` | | `lua_gc` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.gc()` + `lua.gcIsRunning()` | | `lua_getallocf` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getAllocator()` | | `lua_getfenv` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getEnvironment()` | | `lua_getfield` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getField()` | | `lua_getglobal` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getGlobal()` | | `lua_getmetatable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getMetatable()` | | `lua_gettable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getTable()` | | `lua_gettop` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getTop()` | | `lua_insert` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.insert()` | | `lua_isboolean` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isBoolean()` | | `lua_iscfunction` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isCFunction()` | | `lua_isfunction` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isFunction()` | | `lua_islightuserdata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isLightUserdata()` | | `lua_isnil` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isNil()` | | `lua_isnone` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isNone()` | | `lua_isnoneornil` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isNilOrNone()` | | `lua_isnumber` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isNumber()` | | `lua_isstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isString()` | | `lua_istable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isTable()` | | `lua_isthread` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isThread()` | | `lua_isuserdata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.isUserdata()` | | `lua_lessthan` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.lessThan()` | | `lua_load` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.load()` | | `lua_newstate` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `Lua.init()` | | `lua_newtable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.newTable()` | | `lua_newthread` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.newThread()` | | `lua_newuserdata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.newUserdata()` | | `lua_next` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.next()` | | `lua_objlen` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getLength()` | | `lua_pop` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pop()` | | `lua_pushboolean` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushBoolean()` | | `lua_pushcclosure` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushCClosure()` | | `lua_pushcfunction` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushCFunction()` | | `lua_pushfstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushFString()` | | `lua_pushinteger` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushInteger()` | | `lua_pushlightuserdata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushLightUserdata()` | | `lua_pushliteral` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.pushLString()` | | `lua_pushlstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushLString()` | | `lua_pushnil` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushNil()` | | `lua_pushnumber` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushNumber()` | | `lua_pushstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushString()` | | `lua_pushthread` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushThread()` | | `lua_pushvalue` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.pushValue()` | | `lua_pushvfstring` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.pushFString()` | | `lua_rawequal` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.equalRaw()` | | `lua_rawgeti` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getTableIndexRaw()` | | `lua_rawget` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getTableRaw()` | | `lua_rawseti` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.setTableIndexRaw()` | | `lua_rawset` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.setTableRaw()` | | `lua_register` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.registerFunction()` | | `lua_remove` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.remove()` | | `lua_replace` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.replace()` | | `lua_resume` | âž– Hidden, see [Issue #6][ISSUE-6] | | `lua_setallocf` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.setAllocator()` | | `lua_setfenv` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.setEnvironment()` | | `lua_setfield` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setField()` | | `lua_setglobal` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setGlobal()` | | `lua_setmetatable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setMetatable()` | | `lua_settable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setTable()` | | `lua_settop` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setTop()` | | `lua_status` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.status()` | | `lua_toboolean` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toBoolean()` | | `lua_tocfunction` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toCFunction()` | | `lua_tointeger` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toInteger()` | | `lua_tolstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toLString()` | | `lua_tonumber` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toNumber()` | | `lua_topointer` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toPointer()` | | `lua_tostring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toString()` | | `lua_tothread` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toThread()` | | `lua_touserdata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.toUserdata()` | | `lua_type` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getType()` | | `lua_typename` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getTypeName()` | | `lua_xmove` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.xmove()` | | `lua_yield` | âž– Hidden, see [Issue #6][ISSUE-6] | [ISSUE-6]: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/issues/6 ### Auxilary Library Coverage (`luaL_`) | C Type Definition | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `luaL_Buffer` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua.Buffer` | | `luaL_Reg` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua.Reg` and `Lua.RegEnd` | | C API Symbol | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `luaL_addchar` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.addChar()`| | `luaL_addsize` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.addSize()`| | `luaL_addlstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.addLString()`| | `luaL_addstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.addString()`| | `luaL_addvalue` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.addValue()`| | `luaL_argcheck` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkArgument()` | | `luaL_argerror` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.raiseErrorArgument()` | | `luaL_buffinit` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.initBuffer()`| | `luaL_callmeta` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.callMeta()`| | `luaL_checkany` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkAny()`| | `luaL_checkinteger` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkInteger()` | | `luaL_checkint` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.checkInteger()` | | `luaL_checklong` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.checkInteger()` | | `luaL_checklstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkLString()` | | `luaL_checknumber` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkNumber()` | | `luaL_checkoption` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkOption()` | | `luaL_checkstack` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkStackOrError()` | | `luaL_checkstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkString()` | | `luaL_checktype` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkType()` | | `luaL_checkudata` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.checkUserdata()`| | `luaL_dofile` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.doFile()` | | `luaL_dostring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.doString()` | | `luaL_error` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.raiseErrorFormat()` | | `luaL_getmetafield` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getMetaField()` | | `luaL_getmetatable` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.getMetatableRegistry()` | | `luaL_gsub` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.gsub()` | | `luaL_loadbuffer` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.loadBuffer()` | | `luaL_loadfile` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.loadFile()` | | `luaL_loadstring` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.loadString()` | | `luaL_newmetatable` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.newMetatable()` | | `luaL_newstate` | ðŸ†– please use `Lua.init()` | | `luaL_openlibs` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.openLibs()` | | `luaL_optinteger` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkIntegerOptional()` | | `luaL_optint` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.checkIntegerOptional()` | | `luaL_optlong` | ðŸ†– please use `lua.checkIntegerOptional()` | | `luaL_optlstring` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkLStringOptional()` | | `luaL_optnumber` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkNumberOptional()` | | `luaL_optstring` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.checkStringOptional()` | | `luaL_prepbuffer` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.prepBuffer()` | | `luaL_pushresult` | â˜‘ï¸ `buffer.pushResult()` | | `luaL_ref` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.ref()` | | `luaL_unref` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.unref()` | | `luaL_register` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.registerLibrary()` | | `luaL_typename` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getTypeNameAt()` | | `luaL_typerror` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `lua.raiseErrorType()` | | `luaL_where` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.where()` | ### Debug API Coverage (`lua_Debug`) | C Type Definition | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `lua_Debug` | â˜‘ï¸ `Lua.DebugInfo` | | `lua_Hook` | â˜‘ï¸ðŸ“¢ `Lua.HookFunction` | | C API Symbol | Available in `zig-luajit` | |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| | `lua_getinfo` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getInfo()` | | `lua_getstack` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getStack()` | | `lua_gethookcount` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getHookCount()` | | `lua_gethookmask` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getHookMask()` | | `lua_gethook` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getHook()` | | `lua_sethook` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setHook()` | | `lua_getlocal` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getLocal()` | | `lua_setlocal` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setLocal()` | | `lua_getupvalue` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.getUpvalue()` | | `lua_setupvalue` | â˜‘ï¸ `lua.setUpvalue()` | ## Additions to the API in `zig-luajit` The following functions are added in `zig-luajit` and do not necessarily have a corresponding function or macro in the C API. | `zig-luajit` Extension Function | Description | |---------------------------------|-------------| | `lua.getInfoFunction()` | A simplified version of `lua.getInfo()` for inspecting functions, that has a more idiomatic Zig result type. | | `lua.toNumberStrict()` | Gets the value of a number on the stack, without doing type coersion (e.g. from string values). | | `lua.toIntegerStrict()` | Gets the value of an integer on the stack, without doing type coersion (e.g. from string values). | | `lua.toBooleanStrict()` | Gets the value of a boolean on the stack, without doing type coersion based on "truthyness" of the value. | | `lua.openBaseLib()` | Opens the `Base` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openMathLib()` | Opens the `Math` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openStringLib()` | Opens the `String` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openTableLib()` | Opens the `Table` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openIOLib()` | Opens the `IO` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openOSLib()` | Opens the `OS` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openPackageLib()` | Opens the `Package` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openDebugLib()` | Opens the `Debug` Lua standard library. | | `lua.openBitLib()` | Opens the `Bit` LuaJIT standard library. | | `lua.openJITLib()` | Opens the `JIT` LuaJIT standard library. | | `lua.openFFILib()` | Opens the `FFI` LuaJIT standard library. | | `lua.openStringBufferLib()` | Opens the `StringBuffer` LuaJIT standard library. | ## Licensing The `zig-luajit` Zig languge bindings are distributed under the terms of the open and permissive MIT License. The terms of this license can be found in the [LICENSE](./LICENSE) file. This project depends on source code and other artifacts from third parties. Information about their respective licenses can be found in the [COPYRIGHT](./COPYRIGHT.md) file. * [The LuaJIT Project](https://luajit.org/) * [Lua](https://www.lua.org/) ## Credits This project was inspired by [natecraddock/ziglua](https://github.com/natecraddock/ziglua) which provides great functionality if you're looking to use Lua runtimes other than LuaJIT!

releases.name: v2.0.1 - Zig 0.15.1 - 2025-09-01
releases.body:
Update to support Zig 0.15.1 on main

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v2.0.0...v2.0.1

releases.name: v2.0.0
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* [Breaking Change] Fix checkArgument logical error by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/18


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.5.4...v2.0.0

releases.name: Zig 0.14.0 Released
releases.body: This release tracks the official release of Zig 0.14.0: https://ziglang.org/download/0.14.0/release-notes.html

releases.name: v1.5.1
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* Adopt changes to Zig packages in 0.14.0-dev.3460 by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/14


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.5.0...v1.5.1

releases.name: v1.5.0
releases.body:
Version 1.5.0 is the first "Official" release of `zig-luajit` now that it has reached 100% Zig API coverage of the backing C interface.

## What's Changed
* â­Add support for lua.getUpvalue() and lua.setUpvalue() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/12


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.4.0...v1.5.0

releases.name: v1.4.0
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* Add support for lua.getHook(), lua.getHookMask(), lua.getHookCount() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/10
* Add support for lua.getLocal() and lua.setLocal() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/11


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.3.0...v1.4.0

releases.name: v1.3.0
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* Add support for Lua.HookFunction and lua.setHook() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/9


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v.1.2.1...v1.3.0

releases.name: v.1.2.1
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* Add support for lua.getStack() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/8


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.1.1...v.1.2.1

releases.name: v1.1.1
releases.body:
## What's Changed

1. Begin Debug API: add support for lua.getInfo() and lua.getInfoFunction() by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/7

API Coverage:

* Added the Lua.DebugInfo struct, used to wrap the parts of the C API using the lua_Debug struct.
* Added the Zig function lua.getInfo(lua: *Lua, what: [:0]const u8, info: *Lua.DebugInfo) to wrap lua_getinfo().
* Added FunctionKind enum for callers to parse Lua.DebugInfo.what strings. Makes it easier to determine the type of function inspected by getInfo().

Improvements:

* Added the Lua.DebugInfoFunction struct, a simplified and easier to use version of the Lua.DebugInfo struct for inspecting a "dead" function.
* Added the Zig function lua.getInfoFunction(lua: *Lua, func: *Lua.Function, info: *Lua.DebugInfoFunction) to wrap common usage of lua_getinfo() for functions.
* Added pretty print functions for both Lua.DebugInfo and Lua.DebugInfoFunction.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

releases.name: v1.0.0
releases.body: ðŸŽ‰ API is considered stable and semantic versioning will apply for all future changes.

releases.name: v0.4.0-rc1
releases.body: Approaching first stable API version -- after reaching 100% API coverage we will improve test coverage and cut a stable 1.0.0 release.

releases.name: v0.3.0-rc1
releases.body:
## What's changed?

* Functions to control Lua memory allocation behavior have been broken.
    - Introduced functions `Lua.setAllocator(std.mem.Allocator) -> void` and `Lua.getAllocator() -> std.mem.Allocator` to replace ~Lua.setAllocF~ and ~Lua.getAllocF~

## What's changed
* A potentially breaking change to lua.doString() is introduced. The doString() function now accepts a string slice instead of a null-terminated pointer.
* Cutting release for 75% API coverage milestone
* Added `examples/simple-repl` for folks to get started.

releases.name: v0.1.1-rc1
releases.body:
## What's Changed
* Upgrade to zig-luajit-build 1.0.1 to enable support for Windows by @thsackos in https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/pull/1

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/compare/v0.1.0-rc2...v0.1.1-rc1

releases.name: v0.1.0-rc2
releases.body:
Changes from v0.1.0-rc1:

* [Make Lua.Status public, add status(), some incomplete test coverage, more assertions on returned status values](https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/commit/dcf3a8efe6f2fd41a777be840e88ee1036973a08)
* [Rename Lua.LuaStatus to Lua.Status and converge with modern zig enum member naming conventions](https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/commit/67c66940d1eef7b29bb0a4f8232a2a938bd0ec4c)
* [Converge Lua.Type enum with modern zig enum member naming convention](https://github.com/sackosoft/zig-luajit/commit/1cebf2342c13561bf007c7c7a489b821b300f6e4)

releases.name: v0.1.0-rc1
releases.body:
Cutting a release now to mark the stability of the current API. The Zig API that is supported has been tested and validated; however, some minor contract changes may come before the first major version release.

This release is capable of loading Lua code and executing it; and a MessagePack serialization library has been written and validated using the current Zig API bindings.

owner_bio: Building stable foundations for modern software.
